intro: Cuphea thymoides var. argentina, commonly known as the Argentine flamebeard, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Lythraceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular red or orange flowers that resemble flames. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, showy bracts that enhance its ornamental appeal. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil, making it suitable for rock gardens or containers. Its unique appearance and drought tolerance make it a popular choice for gardeners seeking vibrant, low-maintenance plants.
